Food Presentation (i.e. wrapping, boxing): 5
Food Preparation (i.e. made with care): 5
Food Value: (i.e. worth the price): 5
Food Taste: 5
author: Charlie A.

description: Great poke. Usually go for the Hawaiian style. This place is a regular stop for me even though it's a neighborhood away.
author: Zac B.

description: Finally got to try this! It was good. Their ingredients were fresh. The portion sizes were okay, but definitely hard to eat if you don't know what you're doing. I didn't know what I was doing.
author: Kevin L.

description: Got the sushiritto and could not be more thrilled. Totally customizable with three proteins plus crab for $12. Incredibly fresh and flavorful and I was stuffed from eating sushi. Super friendly and helpful staff. I'm definitely coming back!
author: Claire T.

description: A straightforward poke bowl cafe with a lot of options. A large bowl gets you unlimited toppings and four proteins! I was pleasantly surprised with their octopus as well as the freshness of their fish.
author: Sawyer G.

description:
The bowls are tasty - although a tad small especially for a large (was still hungry at the end of it). But the options are wonderful - choice of rice or salad, four proteins, and a plethora of other topping choices that you can add to your heart content (in the large size). 

Because of all the options it was a bit overwhelming for me - and the fact that I'm not familiar with most of the ingredient (had to ask what everything was) I opted for one of their signature bowls: Tango - tuna, shrimp, salmon, octopus, green onions, mango, cucumbers, lemon, fried onions, ponzu - and I added some jalapeños to the mix.

The flavors were wonderful (my only wishes were that there was more of it and that I asked for more fried onions.)

The space is cute but tiny - only a few spaces to sit - I can see it getting pretty cramped if there are a lot of people waiting in line to order. So I suggest to take it to go. The staff was also very nice and didn't rush us at all even when the group of us was taking forever because we were all so indecisive.
author: Shannon H.

description: Fresh and good selection of fish! Got the poke bowl, and I liked the make your own bowl option.  A good variety of toppings to choose from also! Portions were good for the price, especially in the city!
author: Yui N.

description:
When i came here I let them know i have a severe avocado allergy and everyone working took extreme care and broke out fresh knifes and serving utensils.  A+

I got 2 bowls with white rice and i was pleasantly surprised that they take the time to make Seasoned rice sushi rice instead of Plain white.  The fish seemed pretty fresh and had the right amount of marinade for me.  Over all I was pretty satisfied and i will return again in the future.
author: Aaron E.

description:
its close to my house and have some later hours.

I love that they now have crispy onions as a topping.
author: Anne-Mary P.

description: This place is so great  I'm like iffy about seafood but this place is super fresh and the staff is so nice  even though I'm not from the area the next time I come around I'm deff gonna visit again
author: Sydney T.

description: Well done - fresh and customizable choices  - these young entrepreneurs found a great "recipe" for fresh delicious food at reasonable prices !! Served with a smile! Excellent !
author: Dan B.

description:
Mehhhhh.

At almost $14 per bowl, the bowl doesn't quite justify the price. Here's where it came short for me:

I ordered a half salad half brown rice bowl. 
- Very small amount of sashimi in the bowl -- the guy who made the bowl didn't really put in the effort to fill each scoop fully, so for each scoop I got maybe 3-4 small bite size chunks
- Brown sushi rice was overcooked and over seasoned. It was too sticky to be considered sushi rice and had too much rice vinegar in it
- Salad was really tough. While I appreciate the salad being a power greens mix (kale, chard, etc.), the kale was not massaged or destemmed so it was difficult to chew. Super tough and dry. Just go with spring mix!! 
- Avocado or guacamole is $1 extra -- then don't list it on the list of free options!
- Sure, it's a "bowl" but having it in a bowl makes it really hard to eat. Half of my toppings fell off while I was trying to eat it

The fish quality was ok. I'd probably pay $10 for the bowl, but $14 is a bit much for what you get. 

Pokeatery in San Mateo does it better.
author: Michelle K.

description:
This is my go-to poke place near my apartment, and it says something that this is the first place I dragged my bleary, jetlagged arse to after a 12-hour flight from Europe for my first local meal before I passed out for 36 hours.

Having tried a bunch of poke places in SF, both new and old (including the new Poke Delish around the corner), this is my preferred spot in terms of quality, quantity, and price per meal. I love the crunchy texture that the fried onions add, which you can't currently get at Poke Delish. And I love all the add-on options, which are plentiful. I always add avocado for an extra dollar (standard price city-wide, it seems), because it really enhances the meal.

I do think they are a little more generous in terms of amount of fish/proteins in each meal compared to the new poke places I've tried. The fish tastes fresh and is seasoned well in the sauce options. Of course, the bowls and fish are not at all as good, as plentiful, or as authentic as the kind you get in Hawaii -- but, you're not in Hawaii. It's an unfortunate reality for all of us.

I lean towards the sushi burritos here because they taste so filling and the flavors meld better in this giant "burrito" roll as opposed to a bowl. But, with the bowls, you can get the option of less rice by choosing half-rice/half-greens, which is healthier. But, with the bowl option, I get to choose octopus as one of my protein options, which has a chewier texture that's suited better as a bowl than a burrito. The add-on sauces seem to be the same as the new poke places. I like to get a mix of a mayo-based sauce and the shoyu sauce.

Seating can be cramped if it's busy, but people seem in general to do take-out. I like sitting at the window. Tap water is available by request.
author: Robin L.

description: I love me a good poke bowl. However, I was saddened to say that for my 14 dollar build your own poke bowl, I got a severe stomachache afterwards. The price point was a smidge high and I really think that Mango and or avocado should be included for that price. The octopus and the Tina were good, but the salmon seemed a bit off. The space itself is small and industrial but functional with some bar seating.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I'a Poke was an unfortunate letdown. The portion size was incredibly small and not filling. They offer you four scoops of protein in a poke bowl, but I already felt like there wasn't that much fish, even when I doubled up on the salmon and the tuna. Their four scoops seemed incredibly measly. They also oversauced the fish, so that I ended up with a pool of soy sauce at the bottom. The other ingredients seemed ok, but the bowl tasted disjointed and unharmonious.

I've gone to most of the poke places that have opened up in San Francisco, and I would have to say Poki Time in the Sunset is my favorite at the moment. I would not return here, as it feels slightly claustrophobic and I don't like paying a premium for my poke in the Castro for a small amount of food.
author: Catherine N.

description: Everything was delicious except for the fact that it was soggy and fell a part fast. Reasonably price considering how much protein and toppings they give. I think my burrito had more stuff than my brother's poke bowl and his costed more. And since Sushiritto has a set menu, I'a Poke has one up over them once they get the structure down right.
author: Christina B.

description: So good to have delicious poke bowls within walking distance of my house :) L'a Poke is a very welcome addition to Church street! The options of bowls vs. burritos are great, and the ingredients they use are fresh and tasty. I love the Aloha bowl (minus the jalapeños!) Yum!
author: Eliza D.

description:
Debated between 4 and 5 stars. Fast poke concept, think Chipotle but for a poke bowl. Great filling and healthy lunch  with a clean modern concept. They have some signature sushi burritos, I wish they had some signature bowls too to get a good base. 

If you like poke you should definitely check out this place!  $12.50 for a bowl and $1075 for a burrito, great value considering the portions.
author: Mark R.

description:
Solid Poke Bowl.

The Poke is covered in sauce later which makes the meat kind of flavorless and the sauce runs mostly into the rice which is fine with me but I can see why others would be amiss. The ingredients they come with is a great mix of little ingredients and I have to admit I love it. Delicious spot. 

The bowl is super tight and I did even put the entire thing in my backpack and biked around and it held on.
author: Rohan D.

description:
YUM! This small place is great for takeout. We ordered a large bowl to share as a light lunch (I wouldn't recommend sharing one bowl if you're actually hungry) and got tons of toppings on it -  tuna, salmon, yellowtail and shrimp as proteins, and almost every single available veggie topping as well. It was absolutely delicious and I loved the seasoned brown rice as the base. Highly recommend if you like poke or even just sashimi! For ~$15 it's a great deal. 

Protip: get the sauce on the side so it's not oversauced, and make sure you get lemon so you can squeeze fresh lemon juice on your bowl.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Sooo good!! The bowls look pretty small in the Yelp photos but surprisingly, the bowls are actually very filling. I finished 3/4 of my bowl and was already full. It's definitely not a cheap, roughly $13 a bowl/ or $11 sushiritto but completely worth it. 

The fish is incredibly fresh! It's a good place to eat healthy and cut carbs (assuming you order half salad/ brown rice option). The toppings are free so I loaded up with lots of veggies . 

I will for sure come back soon!
author: Sa M.

description: Says they are open yet closed on a Saturday at 1:30!!! I am not happy I drove all the way here for nothing!!!
author: Jade G.

description:
I've seen better reviews for the poke place in the Myriad nearby, but having eaten at both of these places extensively (I live like 2 doors down from I'a Poke) I have to say I much prefer the poke here.

The fish is high quality and fresh, the selection of additional toppings is wide and the portions are generous. They had some logistical issues early on with how they explained their menu, and the glass in front of where you order being too tall (so you couldn't talk to the person preparing your food easily), but those have since been ironed out.

The tastiness of what you end up eating depends a lot on what you choose to put on it, so if you don't like it the first time, give it another shot.
author: Brian S.

description: The poke bowls are amazing! Definitely glad I got the large- you get unlimited toppings. Fresh, flavorful, and everything goes together perfectly. Definitely a place to pick up your food and go more than a lets-sit-down-for-an-hour-and-catch-up kind of place.
author: Sophie C.

description: I got a poke bowl with salmon, marinated tuna, shrimps, and regular tuna. Big portion, good sushi rice, and protein options are very fresh. Cozy place with very friendly staff. Will come back again!
author: Kalena S.

description:
+ THE FOOD
The portion sizes here is pretty big, even if you get a smaller size. They give a generous portion of fish and other sides. The fish is very fresh tasting and the sides complement the fish every well. The bowls are tasty but by the time you finish it, you feel really full and too stuffed. I liked how you can build your own or choose your own pre-set bowl. 

+/- THE PRICES
This place is a little bit more expensive, even for a small. I think I spent almost $20 here when I added on a drink.
author: Cindy C.

description: My first time trying Poke and it was great! The workers here are very helpful and nice. Look out for the Nigahiga doppelgänger that works here! The ingredients are the freshest. I also recommend their tuna tartar with taro chips. It was AMAZING! :)
author: Cici C.

description:
went here today on their second day of soft opening. there was a very short line but service went pretty fast. they were slightly a little frazzled but otherwise it was fine. since it was soft opeing, the toppings weren't limited to 4. they also had ran out of spicy tuna and salmon by the time i got there around 4ish. i got 2 bowls - one with salad and one with rice. They ofer mixed greens and kale which is nice. A goo amount of toppings and fish looked fresh. For $13, you get a good amount of poki of each choice and toppings. Not sure if this will stay the same once they do the grand opening. I do wish the glass was lower where you order as its hard to hear. 

will be back!
author: Tao Tao W.

description: I came for their official grand opening today and I got the courage to order a custom made poke bowl. It was a bit overwhelming at first to pick your ingredients, but I just picked the ones that I were familiar with that I thought would taste good together with white rice, tuna and salmon. They have added more menu items on their board, but I didn't get a chance to read it because the line was starting to form. Next time when I am in, I may order something off the new menu.  The fish was very fresh in the bowl. The portions were good and I am full after eating my small bowl for dinner. So I don't have any complaints. Only three people working behind the counter this evening and all were friendly. Good place to return to try out the other types of bowls and rolls! Yes, it's a bit pricy, but it's tasty and It does take labor to put everything together. It's not like you have time to do it at home yourself. So much easier to buy it and enjoy without having to wash any dishes! :-)  It was smart for the business to have a soft opening two months ago to test their recipes and hear feedback from customers to fine tune their take out restaurant. Good job! Again yummy in my tummy! :-)
author: Priscilla L.

description:
I really love this fresh poke concept! Also very happy these kids brought it to SF! 
It's very tasty options and everything was super fresh and all tasted super yummy! Perfect lunch spot to grab and take to Dolores! 
Loved the tuna, spicy tuna, crab and salmon! 
Super nice staff willing to accommodate and were super helpful with explaining the ropes! Can't wait to come back again!

Only thing I wish wasn't so hot was the rice bc it made all the cold things warm. But that still didn't take away from the taste of anything!
Keep up the good work guys!
author: Melissa M.

description: After lunch here on Saturday, I'm jumping on the Poke bowl bandwagon. I'a Poke usually has a long line, but my friends and I got lucky and only had to wait for 2 minutes. I had a mixed greens bowl with tuna and salmon (you can get up to 4 proteins with the bowl, 3 for the Sushiritto) along with lots of toppings (loved that they had seaweed salad and wakame seaweed). The fish and rest of the ingredients were fresh and the bowl wasn't over-sauced. The bowl doesn't look big, but it filled me up. I'a Poke is pricey, but given how fresh everything is, totally worth it.
author: Joanna C.

description:
I discovered a similar style restaurant in Southern California a couple of months ago and I've been craving some tasty poke and I've been waiting for I'a Poke to open. It was well worth the wait! The restaurant is small but the ambiance is cool and casual, the food is fresh and tasty, the staff is eager to help. 

I like that you can customize your poke bowl ingredients and you have lots of choices of ingredients so you can design a bowl that's just right for you. I like my poke bowl with a bed of white rice, 2 scoops of Spicy Tuna and 2 scoops of Tuna, miso mayo sauce, pickled ginger and topped with edamame, green onions, sesame seeds.

Their Grand Opening will be in a couple of weeks so they will be open a bit later than their current 11am-6pm "pre-opening" hours so this will be an ideal place to pick up dinner to bring home. It's a great value and I know it will be a hit in the neighborhood.
author: Dean J.

description:
Finally! We need more of these kinds of places in the city. Would love to see one in soma/downtown area soon. 

My bowl was made exactly to my liking. Next time might ask to have my different proteins in different sauces, though. 

Toppings included everything I liked: cucumbers, crab, masago, micro greens, seaweed salad, jalapeños, edamame, pickled ginger and wasabi. 

About $13 a bowl after tax. Will definitely be back for poke bowl cravings.
author: Stine H.

description: Protein portion size has been reduced significantly since they first opened.
author: Jeremy R.

description: I've been here numerous times since it opened and absolutely like it so much! I've had the sushi burrito which is similar to sushiritto, but the poke bowls are where it's at. I grabbed a custom large bowl with white sushi rice which comes with 4 scoops of protein. I opted for 2 scoops of salmon, 1 scoop of spicy tuna, and 1 scoop of octopus. Afterwards, I chose all the items listed. They aren't skimpy like other places and it's definitely filling. It's a great addition to the neighborhood and definitely a spot to check out if you're craving something fresh for a meal.
author: EccentricAura A.

description: Amazing poke bowl, puts the LA joints to shame. 4 scoops (marinaded tuna, so actually legit poke), shrimp, octopus and all the toppings you want! Portion is large and filling! Pro tip: get half salad and half brown rice for a nice balance!
author: Kimi N.

description: Ok, I'm impressed. Was skeptical but this place is 2 blocks from home. I stopped by to pick up some lunch and because of my crying baby took my food home to eat. I ordered a poke bowl and couldn't decide between rice and salad so I asked for both which they nicely complied. Fish was fresh, I got spicy tuna and regular tuna w their sesame shoyu dressing and they had all my favorite toppings: wakame, kaiware, masago, avocado and green onions with a dash of furikake. Thank you I'a for getting the Hawaiian flavor right with your shoyu sesame dressing. I for sure will be back as this local island girl needs her poke fix on a regular basis! Woman making my bowl was lovely. The dude at the register could use a little bit more attentiveness. But, hey it's a soft opening. Mahalo!
author: Leslie T.

description:
I love this place because the fish quality is excellent and everything in the bowl is in perfect proportion. 

I live by V16 sushi but find their poke bowls disgusting, so I'd rather walk here. Although the fish at V16 is decent, the toppings and rice are gross.
author: Meg A.

description: I am a die heart poke time fan, discovered l'a poke from a friend and decided to give it a go. First impressions: L'a poke is definitely more of a pick up and go spot and is conveniently located very close to dolores park. L'a poke also offers sushirittos. I ordered a large sushi bowl, it was awesome because I got to get 4 scoops of the protein, and I was able to get 4 different types of protein. The overall poke bowl wasn't too bad, but nothing too overwhelming. I ordered the ponzu soyu to go with my bowl and the flavours weren't bad. A really good spot close to the mission area, if you're in need of satisfying a poke/raw fish craving. You will leave the place satisfied but nothing too overwhelming but it is nice to have the crab salad as one of the toppings.
author: Jessica T.

description: If I could give 6 stars, I would. This place is fresh, innovative and creative. I got the large poke bowl with 4 different protein options. Not only do they just serve poke bowls, Ia poke serves amazing sushi burritos that look and taste amazing. Your orders are made perfectly to your request. :) I highly recommend this place to all my friends!
author: Richard L.

description: Very nice and clean place. The Poke bowl was amazing! Worth the 25 minute walk. The guys that work there were kind and friendly. Thank you for fulfilling my Poke craving.
author: Rachael A.

description: Holy crap this place is amazing. The large Poke bowl is *big*, with a lot of tasty meats, sauces, and greens. I'd recommend getting half salad / half rice as your base.
author: Potluck M.

description:
Happen to find this place while I was in the area with my sister, nice clean but small spot with a few bar seats. Parking is tough during peak hours, they take all forms of payment. Bowls run about $13-15, if you are hella hungry you can definitely finish one yourself, if not it can turn into two meals if you wanted.

You get up to 4 scoops of your protein of choice, white/brown rice/ salad. I got the white rice option but thought it was a little too mushy for my liking, for the fish I did choose 1 scoop premixed spicy tuna which I didn't fancy much, tasted like tuna in bland mayo, than I chose just plain tuna and salmon tossed in their Spicy Mayo sauce mix. That mixed came out a too watery and a bit on the saltier side for me. liquid to mayo ratio was a bit off (I personally like it balanced where the mayo is thin enough to coat the fish and not run off the fish...if that makes any sense)  

Favorite part is adding whatever topping and as much as you want on your bowl, and they'll top it off with sesame seeds or Furikake flakes. I feel like they deserve an additional half star but unfortunately yelp doesn't give us that option so we'll have to settle with this. I'll def. come back and try their other food menu options given the chance!
author: Darling M.

description:
My brother got us take out from I'a Poke today. He built his own sushi burrito which we both loveddd and would prefer over the bowl! Anything in burrito form is always better!!! 

I built my own bowl: 
1) Base: Salad Bowl
2) Protein: tuna, spicy tuna, salmon, and shrimp (shrimp only came with two pieces so maybe I would've gotten something else had I known)
3) Sauce: I asked for one of the "healthier" sauces so he got me sesame shoyu
4) Toppings: All w/ sundried guac

The sundried guac was whatever.. they were a little stingy with it so it wasn't worth the extra $ and I wish they had Unagi here! Other than that, it was a delicious meal! We're def coming back
author: Michelle L.

description: I love love love this place!! So much better than sushirrito and has way more of a selection too. If you like sashimi, you should def check this place out cause sushirrito doesnt really have that many raw fish selection. The only reason why i gave them 4 stars is cause they should probs change their brand of nori to a thicker one bc the burrito breaks half way through eating and the workers didnt roll it tightly enough.
author: Jenny N.

description: sushi burrito is good, but w/ time, the nori gets soggy, and it's hard to chew thru w/o tugging on it and having all the filling come out.  i got the volcano burrito w/ brown rice, and white rice probably would have been better and stickier.  it was still good tho, and HUGE.  the chunks of fish and avocado were also really big and fresh.
author: Helen T.

description:
Okay, OKAY I have been coming here since their soft opening in April and wooosh its already July? Hello Yelp, I guess I am super LATE to write a review to show my love for this place. (Sorry) I dont usually do food reviews. Instagram is full of pictures of my poke burritos from here tho. I think i come here at least twice a week...lol Someone Poke me. 

I don't even know where to start. Their super FRESH seafood and toppings. Toppings you say? Their infinite selection is not only delicious but its so nicely organized on display, so colorful, so clean. I can go on and on about the topping. Their tamago tho. Its gotta be the best tamago I have ever had at a poke place man. Not many places actually include tamago in their topics. Usually an extra. Their sun dried tomato guac is extra tho BUT WORTH EVERY BIT OF IT. Dude, guac in a poke burrito? Um yes please.

This place has a special place in my heart. I don't even live in the City. SUPER worth a drive from the Peninsula. Their staff is so sweet and attentive too :) 

Dear I'a Poke, sorry for not reviewing you until now. Please keep up the pokeful pokelish poke. Oh and my bros gf is from Hawaii and she says this place is for reals. 

xoxo 
your customer who orders a custom burrito with salmon, tuna, octopus, wasabi mayo, tamago, tobiko, cucumber, sun dried guac,& seasoned seaweed *heart*

ps: to those who might say the burrito is "messy to eat", BURGERS are hella messier to eat. But we can choose to eat daintily right? But if its a delish pokeburrito from I'a Poke then, well eat is as "messy" as u can because you gotta eat it fast before someone takes it away from you.

:)
author: Jessica L.

description: My new favorite spot to grab a quick bite at. Love the concept and choices. So far my favorite sushi burrito place in the city. Don't know what the reviewer Dr. L below with two stars is talking about this place has lots of flavor and is not bland at all. He should give it another try. As you can see I don't write alot reviews but when I do you know the food has to be good.
author: Jesse S.

description: Love this place!! The poke is so delicious, with all the right toppings and great service. Definitely recommend it if you are after fresh and healthy poke at a good price!
author: Allie S.

description: Came here while visiting my buddies in San Fran and I gotta say I loved everything about it. Came late night on a Saturday place was empty. I love that you can just create whatever you want or get the signature items. I got the volcano burrito and it was amazing! i would recommend this place to anything wanted a burrito or bowl.
author: David Z.

description: Best poké bowl in town. Don't bother going anywhere else. Great selection of proteins. Great sauces. Great toppings. 5 stars for sure!
author: Justin P.

description: Food was alright, sushiritto is a lot better if you're looking for a sushi burrito. They didn't put a lot of fish inside the burrito and was mainly just avacado. Very pricey for what you get
author: Monique C.

description: Small, but you can't miss this bright blue exterior! I'a Poke offers fresh ingredients and a multitude of options like white/brown rice in a bowl or sushi burrito with choices of protein like shrimp, tuna, salmon, octopus, albacore, and even more toppings. The staff is very friendly and enthusiastic and will gladly offer advice on what to get for first timers!
author: Victoria C.

description: One of my go-to places for poke!  Fish seems fresh, they have a base option with salad greens (just wish they had kale - it stands up to the dressing better without getting soggy), and a nice variety of toppings.  Staff is friendly and efficient, the prices are pretty on par with other poke places in the city, and the food is reliable.  If you like poke, this place is solid.
author: Liz B.

description:
Average.

After having spinfish and poke salad bar in Pasadena, CA (some of the best poke in Socal), this place was subpart/average.

Tried the tango, the rice was over cooked, over seasoned with vinegar,  and COLD, which really disrupted the pallette.

Another thing that was odd was that a small size, limited the toppings to three...Honestly can tobiko and furirkake really even be called a "true topping" or rather a garnish. I've never heard of limiting toppings, except maybe the premium avocado.

The service was very pleasant.

Overall, average/overpriced.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Out of all of the poke places in SF that I have tried this is one of the best places. The place is kind of small, but it's very nice and clean inside. My only complaints are the inconsistent portions, and one of the workers. The portions are very inconsistent even though the items are scooped out the same way. It all depends on the worker who is serving you. Some days you will get a good serving, but other days you will have a small serving. There is one asian lady who isn't the friendliest. She made it seem as if I was bothering her on her break or something. Overall the poke served is fresh and tastes great, as long as it's not from the one lady.
author: S M.

description: Went to this place back in July when it first opened and was looking forward to a good poke shop since it's the new craze and thoroughly enjoyed it and was a great deal... it was full of tuna and salmon and a lot like chipotle style ordering and full to the top. Just went back today for the 2nd time and either they changed owners or the servers were new but the portions were only half the amount that I got the first time, rice was very mushy and overcooked, the tuna was not so fresh.... kinda sad to see this happen since other poke shops are opening up in SF... so this place has a lot of uphill battles
author: Tyson L.

description: Fresh fish, though not the most variety, but still some good options. Nice  portions. They ran out of marinated tuna, but salmon and regular tuna were tasty. Definitely recommend checking this place out of you're nearby and want some healthier food.
author: Michio F.

description: I had the salmon lover burrito which was great! Taste & freshness delicious!  Also ordered the poke rice bowl. My only complaint is the portion size for the poke bowl is disappointing. WAY WAY TOO SMALL! Need to up the portion size by double to be worth what your pay for the bowl. I've been to other poke spots that give ten times more fish, rice, salad, sides for lesser value. If your hungry chose the burrito option which is substantial =)
author: Grace W.

description:
So I've been waiting with bated breath for this place to open and finally the day came! I waited a few hoping they'd work out the kinks and then made my way over after work to grab dinner. Concept is terrific - build your own "poke bowl" or poke burrito (like a sushi burrito). Tiny clean spot and good menu with just enough preset options so you don't have to make too many decisions. 

Here's the thing - it just didn't taste good and because I want to love it and want the business to thrive and want to come back I'm going to tell you what you need to fix ASAP. Please read this and make these modifications ... Because I'm afraid I won't be the only one dismayed by the shortcomings of your current execution of this great concept.

Issues:

1) salmon had no flavor -- despite your adding the wasabi shoyu and even some extra spicy mayo. Just super bland. Maybe the pre marinaded tuna poke is better but the salmon was "blah." Not bad quality but really totally bland. 

2) the rice was bad -- you need to make sure it is cooked through evenly and has enough rice vinegar and salt to come alive. 

3) the burrito construction was poor -- look, I don't know how to do it but I know sushirrito figured it out and I'm sure it's not patented. Get some of their burritos and figure it out. Mine completely fell apart. 

4) the seaweed was bad -- come on, the nori wrapper is important. Don't get the cheap, thin nori with holes because it cannot sustain the pressure and will just bust open. It happened to me and it will happen to others.

5) the burrito concepts are too bland -- just had the salmon and hate to extrapolate but my burrito just didn't pop. Needed something -- spice, seasoning, heat... Maybe more flavorful ingredients could help. If you're trying to save money by sourcing cheaper product you will make more money near term hut ultimately cost yourself customers... 

There were some good things too - the guys were nice, it was easy to pay with square and the add ins (seaweed, cucumber, tomago) were all fine. 

Make the above changes and you'll be off to the races guys. Will give you another shot soon. Good luck!
author: dr r.

description: Super yummy sushi burrito! This is exactly the kind of place that I've been looking for: delicious, healthy, and low-key. The staff were friendly and cheerful. Five stars!!!
author: Purin P.

description: This place was so FRESH. It was like being back in Hawaii -- but only homemade poke was that good. This is really good poke. I found my new go to food place! Would definitely recommend this place!
author: Eric S.

description: The salted and very crispy seaweed is part of what makes these sushi burritos shine! I highly recommend paying the 50 cents extra for the mango, it contrasts perfectly with salty and umami flavors of the ingredients. My sister and I went here 5 times in the 10 days that I was visiting!!
author: Sarah P.

description:
First, it's in the pricey side but the Ingredients are expensive so I can see why they charge so much. The place is pretty tiny and they only had small uncomfortable stools to sit on, which was difficult for my disabled lunch date. You order at the counter but there is a tall window you need to speak over and it was very difficult to communicate with the employees. I was also unsure what many of the toppings and sauces were but the employees happily explained what everything was, a small handheld menu with descriptions would easily remedy this and it would take less time to order.

Cons: not nearly enough sauce, fish did not seem good quality and the spicy tuna tasted off, shrimp also tasted off (more about this later)..

Pros: very good sushi rice, a very filling portion of food, vegetables were seasoned well. 

Unfortunately about an hour after eating lunch my stomach began hurting and I felt nauseous and sick for the rest of the day. I think the fish was poor quality or not prepared correctly because I ended up being very sick tonight.. Such a bummer :(
author: Miss M.

description: This is probably my new favorite quick bite restaurant in the neighborhood. The staff is incredibly friendly and efficient. I try to limit the amount of meat and seafood I eat, so offering tofu with their salad or rice bowls as an alternative gives me life. Don't even get me started about how good their sun-dried  guacamole is. You have to check this place out!
author: Alex C.

description: One of my favorite Poke places in San Francisco. They actually make an effort to have a menu that goes beyond the build your own bowl concept. I like having thoughtful menu items because I don't always know what goes with what and I come to a restaurant to get recommendations on such things. Great location too. Grab some poke and head to Dolores.
author: Justin S.

description: Best sushirittos I've ever had! High quality fish, excellent service and solid portion sides. I highly recommend the Honolulu burrito with added chili powder. Their sundried Guacamole is super tasty!!
author: Dez Y.

description: I've been saying for a while that the Mission needs a good poke place and now it's finally here! This place just opened a week ago and it's already fantastic. It's fast, casual, and pretty reasonably priced for the amount of fish you get. Like Chipotle, you get in line and can choose multiple proteins, sauces, and other toppings. This is probably mostly a place that people will drop by to pick up lunch or to grab dinner on their way home for work, but it's perfect for that. I got a poke bowl last time and I look forward to going back for one of their sushi burritos!
author: Mike W.

description: This place was so good!!! I really enjoyed my bowl. Not only was it well-priced, the employees were very generous with the portions! I will be back for sure
author: Samantha M.

description: Was a bit dubious about this spot but gave it a shot.  The service was excellent but slow.  The portion was way big (and the reason for all the stars).  The taste was ok (the reason for -1 stars).  Was better after I doused it with soy sauce.  Tried making my own - will go for a premade next time.
author: reza n.

description:
Yummy!!! Poke is the new it-girl in SF, so I was excited to try this new place in the Duboce Triangle/Castro area. 

The shop is teeny tiny, with maybe 5-8 bar seats, so get your food to go and hang out in the Duboce dog park! When we came on a weekday for lunch, there were only 2 other people there, so we got to order right away.

The menu consists of Chipotle-style PYO poke bowls, plus some pre-made options. They also have some poke burritos if you wanna eat your poke on the run. They have both small and large bowl sizes - the small is more of a snack IMO and you're limited on the number of toppings so it's worth it to get the large (as many toppings as you want!). With the large, you get 4 scoops of protein, which is nice in terms of variety, but the scoops are actually quite small so you may want to double up on some scoops. For your base, you can pick brown or white rice or mixed greens (or a combo), and for sauces they have ponzu, shoyu, spicy mayo, etc. For the toppings, they have the standard ones for poke bars (masago, seaweed salad, edamame, etc).. plus tamago and crab. Mango and avocado are extra.

I'd definitely go again!
author: J L.

description: Made a special trip out here based on all the rave reviews. Instead of a poke bowl I opted for the salmon sushi burrito for hubby and myself. Upon the first bite taken by my husband, he declared that he thought the salmon burrito from Sushiritto was by far tastier. I then preceded to take a bite of my burrito, While the ingredients were fresh, it did lack some "punch" that a good sauce could have provided. And at these price points, you could probably find a better value at another poki joint in the City.
author: Sandy Y.

description: Yuck. This is a disgrace to poke. This isn't poke, this is some sort of mistranslation of it. Perhaps closer to a chirashi bowl from Safeway. Also, it was $17 with tip.
author: Greg T.

description: I think this place is awesome, you'd pay twice as much for the same amount of fresh sushi just across the street. I don't care for the burrito "format" - it always falls apart and gets messy. But the poke bowls are so good, I'm here at least once or twice a week. Super nice and hardworking staff, always so gracious and polite, even when it gets crowded in this tiny space. Everyone I've brought here loves it and ends up coming back regularly. I've tried a couple of other new poke places recently, this one is by far the best.
author: Philip M.

description: Just wow. Yummy bowl of sashimi slices, veggies, and brown rice. Really filled my to tongue with ectasy and my belly with love. I'll come back for more. Get three scoops. Nice joint too.
author: Pepe W.

description: nice enough people... fish was a bit dry/stale. Flavor lacks for the price
author: Isa M.

description: Everything you could want for your poke fix! Love this place! Great service, fresh fish and toppings.  I already can't wait to to come try another custom bowl!
author: Kim L.

description: I tried their burrito. It's OKAY. It gets soggy and it's not the best. However their bowl is pretty good! You can choose up to four different type of meats and they give you bountiful! It's not the sit down restaurant, but it's definitely a decent grab and go place.
author: Joy M.

description: A great addition to the neighborhood . Healthy, protein-rich options. The bowl is on the pricier side ($13), but once you see the amount of food, it seems pretty reasonable. The only thing that could make this place better is if they offered more menu options of pre-designed bowls. I am not as familiar with different Asian flavored (such as how ponzu and shoyu sauces mix with wasabi or spicy mayo), so I feel uneasy making my own bowl for fear of not doing justice to the ingredients. If they had more predesigned bowl options, it could help speed up the process of ordering and give more ideas of what flavored work well together. That being said, I'll definitely be back!
author: Jacob K.

description: Delicious! Didn't get a bowl, but I ordered the Honolulu sushi burrito and it was amazing. I like how its a little different than Sushirrito! The seaweed paper they use is dried, which is good too! The food tasted very fresh and the burrito was a good size, it filled me up. The establishment wasn't big, but there was enough seating. It was very clean and the staff was nice and helpful. It was around $12 for the burrito, but they don't skimp out on the ingredients, so I truly think its worth it. Don't really have anything negative to say! Give it a shot, you won't regret it!
author: Steven P.

description: Fenomenal, fresh sushi burritos and poke bowls. Great selection of topins and nice service.
author: Guillermo S.

description: Great food. Great concept. A little expensive. They need to work on being faster making the food, but I'm sure that will come with time and a few more employees.
author: Laura S.

description: So good. Quality and quantity. Can't wait to go back. My favorite poki/poke bowl place in the city!!
author: Vivian L.

description: While the food is really good, the managers appear to be sort of rude towards their employees. I was there the other day and I ordered a sushi burrito and I was so excited for it and I added all the toppings that I could (unlimited toppings) and the burrito fell apart. One of the employees apologized and offered to remake it for me but I didn't mind, however, one of the managers berated the employee in front of me. It made me feel really uncomfortable and honestly, I just wanted the burrito. I like the food but not enough to watch the employees get talked down to.
author: Jessica H.

description: Been here twice since it has opened. The first time was great, but the second time I got terrible food poisoning. Maybe my own fault for eating raw fish for lunch, but still. Probably won't be going back.
author: Lucy M.

description: The best sushi burrito I've had. Many raw choices and can build your own. Loved both the Honolulu and Salmon Lover. Flavors are perfect and the fish was fresh and delicious!
author: Suzy L.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood. The poke burritos are surprisingly delicious. And they import the fish from Hawaii - it's legit.
author: Ruben K.

description: Yummy and fresh food! This is only one I will go in SF. You have to try their poke bowl. Fresh fish and plenty of topping! Good job!
author: Dean S.

description: My mom & I came here and she hasn't stopped talking about it. I had a poke bowl and she had the sushi burrito and both were amazing. The workers were sweet and the food was fresh and tasty. Definitely some of the best poke in San Fran!!
author: Shayna M.

description: I've been here a number of times since they've opened and I think their ingredients were fresh and the pokey bowls were tasty. The only reason I would minus one star is because the price is a bit steep for what it is at $13. You get to select from 4 proteins and I often choose salmon, Hamachi, spicy tuna, with regular tuna. I like to have that with ponzu sauce. While most all other toppings are free, I tend to skip the lemon as it can get acidic. I highly recommend the furikake topping which goes at the end. It completes the bowl.
author: Peachie Y.

description: At $12.50 I would expect more fish in my custom bowl. Won't be going again as there are much more fulfilling spots to grab poke in the city.
author: Steven F.

description: Fish is decently fresh, but my server grossly skimped on the portions. While the unlimited toppings are nice, I go to a poke place for FISH, not for rice and condiments.
author: Davis H.

description: I've been trying to find a good poke place I really like and I think I've finally found it! I right and comfy place with really good food. Very generous portions. No ones being shorted with the amount of fish you get. Very recommended!
author: Angelo C.

description: I've been there abut 3 times now since it opened and each Poké bowl was fresh, delicious, and satisfying. I usually get half rice, half salad, two scoops of salmon, two scoops of marinated tuna, and then whatever else I'm into that day - usually avocado ($1 extra). This is easily my new favorite lunch spot.
author: HUNTER B.

description: Got a salad bowl. Tamago (egg), wakame (skinny seaweed), and tuna with sesame shoyu are especially delicious. Next time try albacore (sold out by 8pm-ish)
author: Ryan T.

description: very rude customer service just because i asked for no rice but instead lettuce!.im watchn out on how many carbs i take in and thought it wouldnt be such a major problem with adding lettuce instead.i will never support this business again.
author: Ron S.

description: I rarely review on Yelp, but we really need to keep good places in the neighborhood. Loved my poke bowl! Delicious.
author: Lane S.

description: For 15$ I expect more than 8 cubes of fish and 2 shrimp.  Also, fish is not good quality (way too fatty). I basically paid for some rice and vegetables.  Won't ever come back here.  Blue Hawaiian in the FiDi is much better and you get much more fish for less money, no joke.
author: Adam S.

description: I just got completely freaked out by their unsanitary practices around raw seafood. They were rolling up burritos with unclean materials, fish was spilling out and they were stuffing it back in with their gloved fingers. Then the next burrito (mine-which was vegetarian only because I was worried about the fish quality) had its tofu come spilling out onto the same unclean mat where the fish had just been and then they used the same gloves to stuff my tofu back in. Then, they sliced my burrito in half with the same knife they had just used over and over with raw fish burritos, only casually wiping it off on a towel beforehand. I could see the residue still there after the towel wipe with my bare eyes. I'm worried about getting food poisoning from the contamination and everyone else should be too. They need much more rigorous training for their employees about safe food handling. On the upside, my vegetarian sushi burrito tasted pretty good.
author: ere r.

description: I got spicy tuna with albacore poke. The most important aspect was that the fish was fresh. O have had fresher but for a casual takeout place it was pretty decent. The rice isnt regular sushi rice and I think the bowls would be better if they were. I got the ponzu sauce which was great, next time I will try the mayonnaise. My three topings were edamame, pickled ginger and tobiko/masago. The edamame was a bit on the smaller portion, and they give one spponful each. I asked if I could get a double scoop of the tobiko and they obliged, which I am very happy about...however their tobiko was a bit stale. When it popped in my mouth the flavour wasnt the sweet fish roe flavor i usually am served at sushi restaurants. I am very happy about the fact that the fish was plentiful, it could have been used to make 3 or 4 sushi rolls or more. WILL BE COMING BACK! I think theyre prices are pretty decent and the customer service was friendly. New to go spot!
author: Natalie Charlotte W.
